subject: Re: [junit] possibility to run some tests from separate files
msgSnippet: Dmitry, I m not aware of an existing GUI that would do what you want.  There are ways to get it done in code: are you interested in those, or does it need to
messageBody:
Dmitry,

I'm not aware of an existing GUI that would do what you want. There
are ways to get it done in code: are you interested in those, or does
it need to be a GUI solution?

David Saff

On Fri, Dec 11, 2009 at 3:07 AM, cybernetics.core
<cybernetics.core@...> wrote:
> Hello, *!
>
> A short introduction before question:
> Let's say we are having a different test case files - one for each category, for example
>
> AmFM.java
>    test_AmFmTest1()
>    test_AmFmTest2()
>    test_AmFmTest3()
> Antenna.java
>    test_Antenna1()
>    test_Antenna2()
> Video.java
>    test_Video1()
>    test_Video2()
>    test_Video3()
>
>
> And the question is:
> Is there any possibility to test only some tests from each file, without creating temperatery file (through some GUI with lightbulbes for example?)
>
> Here is example of what we need:
> test_AmFmTest3()
> test_Antenna1()
> test_Video2()
> test_Video3()
>
>
> Is saw the Category option in Junit 4.8 releasenotes, but unfortunatelly it is not the solution - we must not change much code or create new files for this group of tests.
>
> Thank you and you are great!,
> Dmitriy.
>
>
>
